com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.tone_analyzer.v3

Class ToneAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.service.WatsonService
      • com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.tone_analyzer.v3.ToneAnalyzer

  • public class ToneAnalyzer
extends WatsonService
    The IBM Watson Tone Analyzer service uses linguistic analysis to detect emotional, social, and language tones in written text. The service can analyze tone at both the document and sentence levels. You can use the service to understand how your written communications are perceived and then to improve the tone of your communications. Businesses can use the service to learn the tone of their customers' communications and to respond to each customer appropriately, or to understand and improve their customer conversations.
    See Also:
    Tone Analyzer

    • Method Detail

      • tone

        public ServiceCall<ToneAnalysis> tone(ToneOptions toneOptions)
        Analyze general purpose tone. Uses the general purpose endpoint to analyze the tone of your input content. The service can analyze the input for several tones: emotion, language, and social. It derives various characteristics for each tone that it analyzes.
        Parameters:
        toneOptions - the ToneOptions containing the options for the call
        Returns:
        the ToneAnalysis with the response

      • toneChat

        public ServiceCall<UtteranceAnalyses> toneChat(ToneChatOptions toneChatOptions)
        Analyze customer engagement tone. Uses the customer engagement endpoint to analyze the tone of customer service and customer support conversations. For each utterance of a conversation, the method reports the most prevalent subset of the following seven tones: sad, frustrated, satisfied, excited, polite, impolite, and sympathetic. You can submit a maximum of 128 KB of JSON input. Per the JSON specification, the default character encoding for JSON content is effectively always UTF-8.
        Note: The toneChat(ToneChatOptions) method is currently beta functionality.
        Parameters:
        toneChatOptions - the ToneChatOptions containing the options for the call
        Returns:
        the UtteranceAnalyses with the response
